pixel.name: neorgb
pixel.description: Speak NeoPixel to your RGB strips! Treat PWM-able common-anode LEDs as a NeoPixel [16V/3A/channel]

i2c.name: hdc302x
i2c.description: Precision temperature (±0.1°C typical) and humidity sensors (±0.5% typ). HDC3020 / HDC3021 / HDC3022

i2c.name: vl53l4cx
i2c.description: Time of Flight (ToF) distance sensor with about ~1 to 6000mm range + 'multi object detection'

i2c.name: vcnl4020
i2c.description: Proximity sensor works from 0 to 200mm (about 7.5 inches) & light sensor with range of 0.26 to 16,000 lux.

i2c.name: lps28dfw
i2c.description: From 260 to 4060 hPa, this is our largest range pressure sensor (24bit).

i2c.name: mcp9601
i2c.description: Thermocouple / ambient temperature sensor. *Note* Needs hotplugging after i2c scans + selecting component!

i2c.name: nau7802
i2c.description: 24-bit ADC with 128x gain, used with a load cell for weight/force sensing

i2c.name: vl6180x
i2c.description: Time of Flight (ToF) distance sensor with about ~5 to 200mm range

i2c.name: vl53l0x
i2c.description: Time of Flight (ToF) distance sensor with about ~50 to 1200mm range

i2c.name: vcnl4040
i2c.description: Proximity sensor works from 0 to 200mm (about 7.5 inches) & light sensor with range of 0.0125 to 6,553.5 lux

i2c.name: mcp3421
i2c.description: 18-bit ADC. Great for Strain Gauges, Thermocouples and Pressure sensors, between 0 and 2.048 volts

i2c.name: vl53l4cd
i2c.description: Time of Flight (ToF) distance sensor with about ~1 to 1300mm range

i2c.name: aht20
i2c.description: Inexpensive temperature and humidity sensor for I2C-capable boards.

i2c.name: vl53l1x
i2c.description: Time of Flight (ToF) distance sensor with about ~30 to 4000mm range

i2c.name: vcnl4200
i2c.description: Proximity sensor works from 0 to 1.5m (about 59 inches) & light sensor with range of 0.003 to 1570 lux

i2c.name: ds2484
i2c.description: Adafruit DS2484 I2C to 1-Wire Bus Adapter Breakout - Converts a single DS18b20 temperature sensor to I2C

pin.name: tctr1000
pin.description: Optical reflective sensor with digital output, 1-30mm range, and adjustable LED emitter brightness

pin.name: reed_switch
pin.description: A Magnetic Contact Switch (Door/Window Sensor), with Normally Open (NO) or Closed (NC) contacts

ds18x20_metadata.title: DS18X20 Component Definition
ds18x20_metadata.description: A DS18X20 WipperSnapper component for use in Adafruit IO

displayName.description: The human-friendly name of this component.

published.description: If true, this component is supported by the current firmware version and will be displayed to all users. If false, it is hidden behind a developer toggle so that contributors can still work on it against the production site.

description.description: A brief description describing this component's capabilities.

vendor.description: Name of the company that makes this component.

subcomponents.description: The ambient temperature sensor (and its fahrenheit counterpart) standard on DS18X20 Components

sensorResolution.description: The DS18X20's desired sensor read resolution, in bits.

pixel_metadata.title: Pixel Component Definition
pixel_metadata.description: Addressable Pixel WipperSnapper component for use in Adafruit IO

displayName.description: The human-friendly name of this component.

published.description: If True, this component is supported by the current firmware version and will be displayed to all users. Otherwise, it is hidden behind a developer toggle so that contributors can still work on it against the production site.

description.description: A brief description describing this component's capabilities.

vendor.description: Name of the company that makes this component.

pixelsType.description: The type of addressable pixel: NEOPIXEL or DOTSTAR. Corresponds to `PixelsType` in pixels.proto

defaultPixelsOrder.description: The pixel strand's color ordering. Corresponds to `PixelsOrder` in pixels.proto.

autoSelectString.description: A hint for automatically looking up pin names that may be appropriate for this kind of component.

pwm_metadata.title: PWM Component Definition
pwm_metadata.description: A PWM WipperSnapper component for use in Adafruit IO

displayName.description: The human-friendly name of this component.

published.description: If true, this component is supported by the current firmware version and will be displayed to all users. If false, it is hidden behind a developer toggle so that contributors can still work on it against the production site.

description.description: A brief description describing this component's capabilities.

vendor.description: Name of the company that makes this component.

pwmSetting.description: The component's pulse-width modulation setting. Either fixed frequency (variable duty cycle) or variable frequency (fixed duty cycle)

visualization.description: Specifies which visual component to use in the WipperSnapper interface and how to configure it

uart_metadata.title: UART Component Definition
uart_metadata.description: A UART WipperSnapper component for use in Adafruit IO

displayName.description: The human-friendly name of this component.

published.description: If True, this component is supported by the current firmware version and will be displayed to all users. Otherwise, it is hidden behind a developer toggle so that contributors can still work on it against the production site.

description.description: A brief description describing this component's capabilities.

vendor.description: Name of the company that makes this component.

subcomponents.description: List of sensor subcomponents comprising the primary UART component.

baudRate.description: The desired UART bus baud rate, in bps.

inverted.description: When True, this component will invert TX/RX signals on the UART bus.

servo_metadata.title: Servo Component Definition
servo_metadata.description: A servo motor WipperSnapper component for use in Adafruit IO

displayName.description: The human-friendly name of the servo component.

published.description: If true, this component is supported by the current firmware version and will be displayed to all users. If false, it is hidden behind a developer toggle so that contributors can still work on it against the production site.

description.description: A brief description describing this component's capabilities.

vendor.description: Name of the company that makes this component.

frequency.description: The desired frequency of the PWM signal, in Hz.

minPulseWidth.description: The minimum pulse width of the servo, in uS.

maxPulseWidth.description: The maximum pulse width of the servo, in uS.

i2c_metadata.title: I2C Component Definition
i2c_metadata.description: An I2C-based WipperSnapper component for use in Adafruit IO

displayName.description: The human-friendly name of this component.

published.description: If true, this component is supported by the current firmware version and will be displayed to all users. If false, it is hidden behind a developer toggle so that contributors can still work on it against the production site.

description.description: A brief description describing this component's capabilities.

vendor.description: Name of the company that makes this component.

i2cAddresses.description: List of I2C addresses (as hex string, like "0x38") this component can appear on.

subcomponents.description: List of sensors on this I2C component.

pin_metadata.title: Pin Component Definition
pin_metadata.description: A pin-based WipperSnapper component for use in Adafruit IO

displayName.description: The human-friendly name of this component.

published.description: If true, this component is supported by the current firmware version and will be displayed to all users. If false, it is hidden behind a developer toggle so that contributors can still work on it against the production site.

description.description: A brief description describing this component's capabilities.

vendor.description: Name of the company that makes this component.

mode.description: This component's mode, either DIGITAL or ANALOG.

direction.description: This component's direction, either INPUT or OUTPUT.

autoSelectString.description: A hint for automatically looking up pin names that may be appropriate for this kind of component.

selectPullUp.description: If true, the user will be able to select pull up or down options.

pull.description: This component's pull setting, either UP or DOWN.

selectReadMode.description: If true, the user will be able to select the read mode between pin and voltage options.

analogReadMode.description: For ANALOG mode components, specifies whether to read values (PIN_VALUE) or voltages (PIN_VOLTAGE). Will be a default if `selectReadMode` option is true.

defaultPeriod.description: If present, the component form will allow the user to set its period, with this value as the default (in seconds)

forceOnPeriod.description: If true, the user must specify a period (won't be optional in the form).

visualization.description: Specifies which visual component to use in the WipperSnapper interface and how to configure it
